org.jerkar.tool.builtins.eclipse

Class JkBuildPluginEclipse

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jerkar.tool.JkBuildPlugin
      • org.jerkar.tool.builtins.javabuild.JkJavaBuildPlugin
        • org.jerkar.tool.builtins.eclipse.JkBuildPluginEclipse

  • public final class JkBuildPluginEclipse
extends JkJavaBuildPlugin
    Provides method to generate and read Eclipse metadata files.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      java.lang.String jreContainer
      If not null, this value will be used as the JRE container path when generating .classpath file.
      boolean smartScope
      Flag for resolving dependencies against the eclipse classpath
      boolean useAbsolutePathsInClasspath
      Flag to set whether 'generateAll' task should use absolute paths instead of classpath variables

      Shorthand for useFileDependencyInsteadOfProjectFor(File...)
      void useProjectDependencyInsteadOfFileFor(java.io.File projectDir, java.io.File dependencyFile)
      If your project has a dependency on file/folder (a jar or a class dir) that is the result of the compilation of another Eclipse project, then you can generate .classpath in such it has a dependency on the project itself instead of the file/folder.

      • slaves

        protected java.util.List<JkBuild> slaves(java.util.List<JkBuild> originalSlaves)
        Description copied from class: JkBuildPlugin
        Override this method if this plugin add/remove some slave projects. The original slaves are passed as parameter so plugins are aware of already declared slaves. Note that you are not supposed to modify the list passed as parameters and that the returned list is supposed to be the exhaustive list of slave projects, so if the plugin do not remove any slave from the original list, the returned list should contains the list passed as parameter.
        Overrides:
        slaves in class JkBuildPlugin

      • useProjectDependencyInsteadOfFileFor

        public void useProjectDependencyInsteadOfFileFor(java.io.File projectDir,
                                                 java.io.File dependencyFile)
        If your project has a dependency on file/folder (a jar or a class dir) that is the result of the compilation of another Eclipse project, then you can generate .classpath in such it has a dependency on the project itself instead of the file/folder.
        Parameters:
        projectDir - root folder of the project generating the class jar
        dependencyFile - the dependency file your project depends on.

      • useFileDependencyInsteadOfProjectFor

        public void useFileDependencyInsteadOfProjectFor(java.io.File... projectDirs)
        If your project has a dependency on computed dependency to a slave project (generally declared as .on(slaveBuild.asJavaDependency())), Eclipse will generate a .classpath with a dependency of slave project.
        If you want Eclipse .classpath uses jar file produced by this project along its transitive dependencies instead of the project itself, this method will tell Eclipse plugin to use jar file + transitive dependencies for the specified project
        Parameters:
        projectDirs - root folder of the projects for which you don't want to use Eclipse project dependency.

      • useFileDependencyInsteadOfProjectFor

        public void useFileDependencyInsteadOfProjectFor(JkJavaBuild... javaBuilds)
        Shorthand for useFileDependencyInsteadOfProjectFor(File...)

      • configure

        public void configure(JkBuild build)
        Description copied from class: JkBuildPlugin
        Configure this plugin according the build instance it is applied on.
        Specified by:
        configure in class JkBuildPlugin

      • addProjectFromClasses

        @Deprecated
public void addProjectFromClasses(java.io.File classesDir,
                                               java.io.File projectDir)
        Deprecated. Use the opposite useProjectDependencyInsteadOfFileFor(File, File) instead (be careful arguments are inverted).
        When a file dependency is found at classesDir, make a project reference instead of a class folder reference in the .classpath file.
        Parameters:
        classesDir - directory of the classes
        projectDir - directory of the project
